titlestmt.titleproper: C.S. Rafinesque correspondence with William Wagner 1840-1961 1840
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: C.S. Rafinesque correspondence with William Wagner

bioghist.p: Constantine Samuel Rafinesque (1783-1840) was a professor of botany, natural history and modern languages at Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky from 1818 to 1826. He published on a wide variety of topics, including botany, ichthyology, economics, and the Bible.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence between Rafinesque and William Wagner concerning collections and books. Rafinesque requests payment for books which Wagner thought had been lent to him. These letters were transcribed and published in Science Magazine (March 23, 1900) by Thomas L. Montgomery.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
